author: Akane Otani
title: Stocks Still Have Momentum as Aging Bull Market Turns 9
text:
The bull market turns nine years old Friday, extending an epic run for U.S. stocks even as concerns about heightened volatility and inflation have slowed the pace of the rally in recent weeks.
It has been 2,266 trading days since stocks hit their financial crisis trough on March 9, 2009. In the years that have followed, corporate profits have regained their footing, while the unemployment rate has fallen to 17-year lows and the pace of global economic growth has accelerated.
...
